title: LoL client using to much RAM on mac
body:
Its been going for a while and my ram is always being consumed by the LoL client and the game. Usually when im not in game the client take up around 500mb of ram and when it's in game it tends to go up 600-700mb of ram (for some reason). Just wondering why this is happening to mac (not sure if it happens to windows users) but it does consume a bit of ram. 

Mac details
Mac Book Pro 13-inch mid 2012 
Processor: 2.5GHz Inter Core i5
Memory: 4GB 1600 MHz DDR3
Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4000 512mb 
Software: OS X 10.8.5 

If it's all good if riot does change something to this that would be great 
(will update post with activity monitor and ram usage)

replies.body:
read, bro. Memory: 4GB 1600 MHz DDR3
It's a standard 2012MBP13.

Eh, Adobe has always been kinda heavy-ish, regardless of the system. Also, it runs in the background during games. Always. Not much you can do except, if you find that being a problem, upgrading the RAM.
I did it recently on my MBP and it sure helped. But then again i hadn't done maintenance or upgrades in 5 years, so it was kinda time.

Do you use MemoryMonitor or something else by any chance?

Well I use memory clean as a application to clean my ram and it sure does work but then it just doesn't clean all of it since it all comes back as inactive ram when i have LoL client open. I've had my mac for 3 years and i've had minor problems with battery and stuff. (recently had a problem with my Hard drive to motherboard cable but league still runs fine after that). But since im in year 9 and in year 10 end of term 1 we have a option to own these macs for our own and receive another for school. Ive been thinking about upgrading the ram to 8Gb when I receive it as my own laptop. But anyhow I do receive 60fps on mac version and on my boot camp windows i receive 120fps.
